Title: Portrait of Shah Abbas I
Description: According to the inscription in the upper panel of this manuscript leaf, Walters W.713, this painting depicts the Safavid ruler Shah 'Abbas I (reigned 996 AH/AD 1588-1038 AH/AD 1629). It was likely produced in India in the 12th century AH/AD 18th. The Safavid ruler is shown in a stylized landscape. The blue, gray, and salmon borders are decorated with illuminated floral and zoomorphic motifs.
Keywords: Indian; Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Illustration; Miniature; Painting; India; Iran
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Indian
